column23: The psychiatry residency program at Carolinas Medical Center offers unique experiences such as ACTT, telepsychiatry, behavioral health integration, and the area's only 24-hour psychiatric emergency room. Comprehensive clinical rotations will be provided in inpatient and outpatient services, primary care, emergency psychiatry, and consult-liaison. Our location in Charlotte, NC makes it a perfect place for recreation, culture, and sporting events.

column23: Telepsychiatry training and experience in rural areas is available. PGY2 residents complete a month of inpatient telehealth with the site in North Platte, NE. Two PGY III residents have a year-long continuity clinic with our rural site in Kearney, NE. Parental leave, four weeks of paid leave not counted as sick or vacation time. Must meet eligibility requirement of having worked for the university for one year, thus PGY1 not eligible until they advance to PGY2.

column23: BNBMC, the largest residency program in NJ, provides training rotations in all psychiatric specialties under one roof in a highly desirable suburban location. We graduate residents who are well-trained, confident, ready to meet the challenges of subspecialty fellowships or independent practice in all settings. This is demonstrated by the consistently top-notch fellowship programs and superior job placements our residents obtain. Our program has a reputation for outstanding training.

Child and adolescent, geriatric, addiction, consult/liaison psychiatry, and perinatal/infant mental health fellowships available. There is a five year combined adult/child psychiatry program for two residents per year, allowing more child opportunities during adult training and guarantees a position in the child fellowship upon successful completion of the PGY3 of training.

column23: Our mission--for residents to become leaders in academic psychiatry--leverages Mount Sinai's culture of flexibility. We have a wealth of raw materials that residents fashion into unique experiences with freedom to innovate. We also have two research tracks. Our physician-scientist track provides maximal protected research time for those who already have MD/PhDs. Our 7-year NIMH-funded residency + PhD program allows residents to earn a PhD in genetics/genomics, neuroscience, or clinical research.

column23: The psychiatry residency program at Prisma Health Columbia, strives to provide an educational and scholarly environment that will train residents to be both knowledgeable and confident in patient care, research, clinical teaching, and systems development. Our program offers a four-year integrated psychotherapy and psychopharmacology curriculum that also includes integrated clinics, telepsychiatry, early subspecialty exposure, emphasis on residents as teachers, and a wellness curriculum.

Year specific didactics, QI projects, Grand Rounds and conference presentations round out the learning experiences. Our close-knit resident group also enjoys many recreational activities.

column23: Our clinical training is broadly diversified with training in inpatient, outpatient, general hospital, community, integrative, VA, and homeless psychiatry settings. We offer a broad range of research opportunities for residents. Our vision is to train leaders of psychiatry who generate and implement new knowledge in the service of a more personalized care of the person who experiences mental illness. The program seeks academically accomplished, mature, and compassionate residents.

column23: The general psychiatry residency training program in the department of psychiatry and behavioral sciences offers a four-year program. Its overall training objective is teaching residents the fundamentals of acute and long-term treatment of psychiatric patients. We offer training in the biological, psychological, behavioral, and socio-cultural aspects of psychiatry and strive to prepare residents for successful careers that emphasize clinical practice, scholarship, teaching and research.

column23: The Emory radiation oncology program strives to train high quality oncologists skilled in the application of radiotherapy. Residents will receive training in IMRT, IGRT, SBRT, IORT, HDR brachytherapy, LDR brachytherapy, and proton therapy. Scholarly activities are encouraged through dedicated research blocks as well as a formal clinical trials course.

column23: The Department of Radiation Medicine at Hofstra/Northwell offers a structured/individualized training program in Radiation Oncology with up to one year of dedicated research. Our mission is to nurture & inspire the careers of future academic & clinical leaders in Radiation Oncology & prepare residents to enter academic or private practice. We have outstanding teaching, diverse pathology, generous resources, & research opportunities at The Feinstein Institute & Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory

column23: Our Residency Training Program is a four-year program designed to prepare qualified applicants for careers in radiation oncology. Our program is apart of the National Cancer Institute-designated Dan L Duncan Comprehensive Cancer Center. The program consists of three primary participating teaching sites including the Harris Health System/Smith Clinic, Michael E. DeBakey Veterans Affairs Medical Center, and Baylor St. Luke's Medical Center.

column23: The diagnostic radiology program at Franciscan Health Olympia Fields is a 5-year categorical residency dedicated to training well qualified physicians to become competent diagnostic radiologists. Our excellent case load, favorable faculty-to-resident ratio, access to state-of-the-art imaging equipment, and proximity to some of the nation's foremost medical institutions help our residents gain an outstanding education in radiology. Follow us on twitter @Franciscan_Rads!

column23: Our program is a categorical 5-year program, including an internship at Ochsner. We have a high volume of case material over a broad range of primary and specialized tertiary care pathology. Residents also receive extensive procedural experience in our busy tertiary level IR section. We offer ESIR pathway for residents interested in IR and a pathway to dual certification in DR and NM. Approximately 95% of our graduates have entered competitive fellowships.

column23: The Einstein Healthcare Network includes urban and suburban hospitals, as well as level 1 trauma and transplant centers. It is the largest independent academic medical center in the region with a long-standing commitment to outstanding medical education, quality patient care and research. Einstein Montgomery residents read studies across the network via a common PACS. Residents at all sites are taught and supported by the faculty and resources across the entire Einstein Network.

column23: Our DR Residency benefits from an outstanding teaching faculty branched out across our city and based at our 5 centers of clinical excellence. Our radiology residents are chosen for their high caliber in academic performance and for recognition of dedication to service, research and leadership. Residents complete core requirements in the first 3 years of radiology training. The final year can be devoted to research, teaching, early sub-specialization, or in-depth education in more than 1 field.

column23: Our conferences and teaching rounds stress the application of basic science as it applies clinically. Our curriculum integrates anatomy, physiology and clinical pathology. Our residents receive extensive laparoscopic experience and practice through our Surgery Skills Lab.

column23: Our I-6 program is designed to train motivated candidates to become academic leaders in Thoracic Surgery. The first three years entail comprehensive training in prerequisites for cardiothoracic surgery, including general/vascular surgery, cardiology, and critical care. The last three years are devoted to extensive training in all aspects of cardiothoracic surgery. There is also an exceptional opportunity for interested trainees to earn a concurrent PhD.

column23: We have one of the most mature integrated thoracic programs in the country. Our I-6 provides excellent training with an integrated, multidisciplinary, competency-based and resident centric approach. Our graduates are well employed and fully competent to provide excellent patient care.

column23: Indiana University vascular surgery serves as the principal tertiary care referral network for vascular disease across the state. We support both an integrated vascular surgical training program (0+5 track with 2 years of research) and an independent vascular surgery fellowship program (5+2 program). Training is offered in 3 major health facilities that includes a university hospital, VA facility, as well as a county hospital.

column23: Our division has a longstanding commitment to educating future leaders in the field. We were the 4th 0+5 program in the country, offering excellent training in both open and endovascular techniques. We performed >125 aortic operations last year (40% open), 200 CEA, 145 leg bypasses, and >1000 endovascular procedures. We are committed to thorough, high quality training, in a friendly and respectful environment.

column23: The goal of our training program is to provide a high quality education that appropriately prepares trainees to face future challenges in the field of vascular surgery. The faculty of the department of cardiothoracic and vascular surgery is committed to help each resident become independent and proficient in the management of all surgical and medical aspects of vascular disease. Trainees are exposed to the full spectrum of vascular disorders treated by both open and endovascular procedures.

column23: The UW Division of Vascular Surgery offers world-class training in cutting-edge techniques at multiple sites of practice. Our Integrated Residency (0+5) and traditional fellowship (5+2) produce surgeons capable of handling any vascular pathology. Each of our four sites of practice is unique, offering training in all facets of vascular disease. We're actively involved in all vascular traumas referred to the only Level I trauma center in the WWAMI region. Numerous opportunities for research exist.

column23: Over the course of the five-year clinical training period, vascular residents will spend a total of 24 months on core surgery rotations and 36 months on vascular surgery rotations. Residents are required to participate in 2 years of dedicated research experience. 4th year residents have the opportunity to participate in a global health elective in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. Residents receive an annual well-being benefit of $500. Parental leave for parents allows for up to 6 weeks of paid leave.

column23: MCF residents are trained to lead their communities. Residents become proficient in robotic, laparoscopic, endourologic, prosthetic and reconstructive surgeries. MCF faculty subspecialize in oncology, endourology, incontinence, men's health, BPH, female pelvic surgery and pediatrics. Training is based on a mentorship model. Skill acquisition is individually paced and rewarded with early and sustained surgical exposure. Recent grads have logged 160 lap nephrectomies & 150 robotic prostatectomies,

column23: Ochsner urology residency offers state of the art training. Graduates from this program are excellent surgeons who graduate with the ability to treat any patient. You will also have the training resources to obtain a fellowship if you desire. Our faculty is diverse with all subspecialties well-represented. We take pride in the good rapport amongst residents and faculty. Ochsner will provide you with a breadth of experience, leaving you equally prepared for either private practice or academics.
